subject: Re: [junit] Ant could not create task : junit
msgSnippet: Indeed, I had the problem you stated and your solution worked. thank you. On Fri, 11 Mar 2005 16:40:28 -0000, Jonathan Oddy
messageBody:
Indeed, I had the problem you stated and your solution worked. thank you.


On Fri, 11 Mar 2005 16:40:28 -0000, Jonathan Oddy
<j.oddy@...> wrote:
> Hi Selva,
> I've not been paying attention so somebody might have already said this.
> Is the message you're getting similar to:
> BUILD FAILED: C:\sandbox\code\build\build.xml:199: Could not create task or
> type of type: junit.
>
> If so you need to explicitly inform Ant within Eclipse where junit.jar is.
> Do this by bringing up the Eclipse Ant configuration dialog (context menu
> "Run Ant..." on your xml file). Go to the classpath tab and add an entry
> for junit.jar (via "Add JARS...", or "Add External JARS..." button)
>
> Jonathan
>
> ________________________________________
> From: Bradley, Todd [mailto:todd.bradley@...]
> Sent: 11 March 2005 15:48
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Ant could not create task : junit
>
>
>
> > I had problems running junit task and had to keep the junit jar
> > (junit3.8.1.jar) in ant lib folder (ANT_HOME/lib) and use a
> > <classpath /> with all the ant lib jars added to it.
> >
> > This works when I run the build script through ant from command line.
> > The same build script will not work from within Eclipse. Not sure why.
>
> It could be that when you're running ant from within Eclipse, you're not
> using the ant you think you're using. That's happened to me before. By
> default, Eclipse uses its own ant, which has its own ant/lib, which
> doesn't come with the JUnit jars in it. My solution was to configure
> Eclipse to use the same ant I used from outside Eclipse.
>
>
> Todd.
>
>
